column4: Hello guys, ive been trying to install ubuntu through wubi and have been running into a small problem.  When I boot into the "linux" boot option to install ubuntu, I get an error (something about drive 80 and having to run fdisk).  I have run chkdsk and done a defrag on the drive in question, it all checks out.
Why not just install ubuntu with a CD?
normally I would, but my cd drive is running off a IDE controller card and does not get recognized by the Mobo
